N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 489.11 - Food service

State Regulations
(a) The operator shall provide: (1)
three meals a
day; (2)
a nutritious evening
snack; and
(3)
regular diets and
modified diets as required by the resident, except that an operator may elect
not to admit or retain residents who require modified diets. (b) Information on each resident's
prescribed dietary regimen, food allergies, and individual food preferences
shall be used in planning, preparation and service of resident meals and
snacks. (c) The operator shall
provide meals which are balanced, nutritious and adequate in amount and content
to meet the dietary needs of residents. (d) Meals shall be varied in methods of
preparation and content. (e) Each
day's menu shall include a hot entree at one meal other than
breakfast. (f) No more than 15
hours shall elapse between service of the evening meal and breakfast the next
morning. (g) The operator shall
make provision for meals for residents engaged in off-site programs during
regularly scheduled meal times. (h) Food on hand shall be sufficient to permit the service of meals for a minimum
of three days. (i) Food shall be
stored, prepared and served in such a manner as to insure its safety and
nutritional value. (j) There shall
be a sufficient supply of dishes, glasses and utensils in the home to meet the
needs of the occupants of the home. (k) Residents shall not be made to dine
separately from the other members of the household. (l) Home canning is permitted, provided

United States Department of Agriculture procedures are used. (m) During each semi-annual inspection of the
home, the local department of social services shall review meal preparation and
the current week's menu, as planned, with the operator and residents to assess
operator compliance with food service requirements. Notes
